page.title: 01Dairy Farming S. of Chorley
page.content: The whole area is dairy farming, about 25% of the area is owned by Cholmondeley Estate Co. the remainder are owner occupied. The area is very intensive, usually farmers claim for 1 to 1.25 cows per acre. Milk quota have curtailed futher output. Average farm size is about 100 acres. Artificial fertilizers are used in large quantities up to 350 units per acre. During the summer, cow grazing is controlled by electric fencing, silage is made for winter feeding. very little hay made because of the weather. Cows are now found in cubicles rather than traditional shippons. The predominant breed is "British Fresian" although Holstein fresians are increasing.
